title: Ken Hom’s steamed chicken with Chinese sausage
portion: Serves 4-6 as part of a sharing menu
time: Hands-on time 10 min, steaming time 25 min, plus marinating
description: Ken Hom’s quick and easy steamed chicken dish is designed to be served as part of a sharing menu to celebrate Chinese New Year. Try this dish with Ken’s crispy fish spring rolls and stuffed bitter melon with black bean sauce.
ingredients: 450g free-range skinless boneless chicken thighs, cut into bite-size pieces
1½ tbsp shaoxing rice wine or dry sherry
4 Chinese pork sausages (about 100g), cut into 1cm slices – see Know-how
Steamed rice and greens to serve
Steamer or large wok/pan with a lid and a rack set inside; lipped heatproof plate or bowl that will sit inside the steamer

method.Step 1: Stir together the chicken, soy, rice wine, sugar, sesame oil, cornflour and some black pepper in a bowl. Leave to marinate at room temperature for 20 minutes (see Make Ahead).

method.Step 2: Transfer to the plate/bowl and mix with the sliced sausages.

method.Step 3: Set up a steamer (or put a rack in a large wok or deep pan) and add 5cm of water. Bring to the boil, lower in the dish of chicken/sausages, turn the heat to low, cover and steam for 25 minutes or until cooked through. Serve garnished with shredded spring onions, with steamed rice and greens on the side.
